channel.title: [Q] Randomising
channel.description:
At the moment, I don't have time to check this, so i'll post here and check it later ^^
I was wondering if it's possible to randomise from 2 different sections of the ItemDef.xml.
For example.
When you use a cracker with another player, it will randomise from the items 576 - 581 (Phat Id's).
[code]InvItem phat = new InvItem(DataConversions.random(576, 581));[/code]
Is this possible to randomise through more than 1 section, such as:
[code]InvItem phat = new InvItem(DataConversions.random(576, 581)); else { InvItem runes = new InvItem(DataConversions.random(31, 36));[/code]

item.title: [Q] Randomising
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Nope, I am South Korean. ^^

Read full topic

Thank you for your input, lolwat. Of course different/better names will be used; phat was just used as an example.

Thank you for the input, Pesterd.

Yong, your so awesome and nice its insane Send regards to the fam
[/quote]

Thank you. I will surely send them your regards.

Also all the best to you and your family ^^[/quote]

So polite, you’re not english, are you?

item.title: [Q] Randomising
item.dc:creator: @lolwat22 lolwat22
item.description:
@lolwat22 wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:6, topic:268652”][quote author=yong min link=topic=354517.msg2716100#msg2716100 date=1237665728]

Your trying to randomize id 576-581 and 31-36?

Yes, I was wondering if it’s possible to randomise amongst more than 1 set of items within different parts of the items that aren’t next to each other in corresponding order.
[/quote]

Well, one way would be to add this to InvUseOnPlayer

[code]
private static final int [] IDS = {
576, 577, 578, 579, 580, 581, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 36
};
private static Random r = new Random();

public static int Rand(int low, int high)
{
   	return low + r.nextInt(high - low);
}

public static int getRandomid()
{
	return IDS[Rand(0, IDS.length - 1)];
}
[/code]

Ofcorse you will need to import random

import java.util.Random;

and change

 InvItem phat = new InvItem(DataConversions.random(576, 581));

to

InvItem phat = new InvItem(getRandomid());[/quote]You should probably use a better name for the random phats so you don’t get confused later on.

Read full topic

item.title: [Q] Randomising
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:5, topic:268652”][quote author=adu link=topic=354517.msg2715978#msg2715978 date=1237659022]
Your trying to randomize id 576-581 and 31-36?
[/quote]

Yes, I was wondering if it’s possible to randomise amongst more than 1 set of items within different parts of the items that aren’t next to each other in corresponding order.[/quote]

Well, one way would be to add this to InvUseOnPlayer

[code]
private static final int [] IDS = {
576, 577, 578, 579, 580, 581, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 36
};
private static Random r = new Random();

public static int Rand(int low, int high)
{
   	return low + r.nextInt(high - low);
}

public static int getRandomid()
{
	return IDS[Rand(0, IDS.length - 1)];
}
[/code]

Ofcorse you will need to import random

import java.util.Random;

and change

 InvItem phat = new InvItem(DataConversions.random(576, 581));

to

InvItem phat = new InvItem(getRandomid());

Read full topic

item.title: [Q] Randomising
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“Peter, post:2, topic:268652”]DataConversions.random(576, 581) gives a random number between 576 and 581
DataConversions.random(31, 36) gives a random number between 31 and 36[/quote]

First of all, thank you for a fast reply.

I am fully aware of the fact it will give a random number between the two ID’s given, however i’m not sure I made myself clear enough for you to fully understand my question.

I was wondering if it’s possible to use more than 1 DataConversions.random.

If I want an item with the option “open” for example, is it possible to make it randomise from two different sections of the ItemDef.xml (ID’s) to determine what the outcome item is.

Read full topic

item.title: [Q] Randomising
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

DataConversions.random(576, 581) gives a random number between 576 and 581
DataConversions.random(31, 36) gives a random number between 31 and 36
